results.title: Overture: Linh from Vietnam
results.creator_credit: Learning Corporation of America, Elaine Sperber and Seth Pinsker
results.brief_description: Docudrama which tells about young Linh Tran and her family, who have settled into their first real home since immigrating to America from Vietnam. Discusses the social hardships they incur, the adjustments they must make to a new culture, and the girl’s friendship with a Mexican-American boy. Cast includes: Pandito Gomez, Kim Ngan Ly, Michael Leon and Stanley Brock

results.title: Overture
results.creator_credit: United Nations. Dept. of Public Information
results.brief_description: Beethoven’s “Egmont Overture”, played by the Vienna Philharmonic Orchestra, conducted by Carl Schuricht, is a musical background for scenes symbolising the work of the United Nations in combating disease, ignorance, war, devastation, starvation and misery.

results.title: Overtaking and being overtaken
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Skills of Defensive Driving”.
Suggests ways in which the defensive driver can overtake and how to react to being overtaken. Shows the pitfalls leading to accidents while overtaking and being overtaken. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Overspill
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Svenska filminstitutet, Tom Daly, John Kemeny and Mort Ransen
results.brief_description: A film about Norrbotten, in northernmost Sweden, where industrial and agricultural patterns have changed and people are being relocated in industrial towns far from the life they have loved. In a series of interviews we meet people who have known the dignity of independence and who have suddenly become welfare cases. The film asks: Are their lives being improved? How can we reconcile human values and economic needs?

results.title: Overnight Sensation
results.brief_description: A drama that focuses on a man’s reaction to the unexpected success of his wife’s first novel. The husband, who sees his wife in a traditional role, is compelled to deal with a radically new perspective on their relationship. Departing from the original plot, the film’s ambiguous ending allows viewers to make their own interpretation of the conclusion.

results.title: Overland with Cobb & Co.
results.brief_description: A journey through the outback by Cobb & Co coach. Cobb & Co have a unique place in Australia’s past. The growth of the company went hand in hand with the development of rural Australia. In many ways it made development possible, providing an essential fast transport system on which the rural areas depended. By 1870 Cobb & Co were harnessing 6,000 horses a day to haul their coaches over 28,000 of track every week.
